column4: I have just installed 11.04 and my USB Audio Headset has got a very low volume, is this a well known problem? Anything I can do? All the sliders are on max already... <- solved by upping the volume via alsamixer.... this bug also existed in 10.10 and 10.04 im gonna report this now
11.04 is in Beta. We will/cannot help you. Ask in #ubuntu+1
Yeah, but it also affects 10.10 and 10.04
Hardware issue then?
thanks for the advice though
its a standard usb audio device
but no worries ill report this as a bug on launchpad in a sec
koritsa: If you're running a webserver you won't (shouldn't) have the GUI and thus no software centre
Doesn't mean it isn't broken. Or your audio hardware for your PC
it isn't broken.
Does it work on anything before 10.04 or another operating system?
there are people on ubuntuforums.org with this same issue and posts from early 2010
it works on mac os and windows of course
driver issue with Linux/Ubuntu then most likely
the only problem is that the alsa volume is set to 1%
and all the ui sliders in ubuntu dont handle the alsa volume
polah: since many others have usb audio issus with different headsets I would guess it is like that for all usb audio devices
Look for a command to increase volume?
my original post stated that i have solved this
I just posted it here because I asked it myself
and I included the question with the answer, thats all
